Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are promising power-generation systems to utilize methane or methane based fuels with a high energy efficiency and low environmental impact.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane

Sentencas: A successive multi-stage process is performed to explore the operation of cells using dry methane or the deposited carbon from methane decomposition as fuel.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane

Sentencas: Stable operation can be maintained by optimizing the fuel supply and current density parameters.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane

Sentencas: An electrochemical impedance analysis suggests that the partial oxidization of Ni can occur at anodes when the carbon fuel is consumed.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane

Sentencas: The stability of cells operated on pure methane is investigated in three operating modes.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane

Sentencas: The cell can run in a comparatively stable state with continuous power output in an intermittent methane supply mode, where the deposition and utilization of carbon is controlled by balancing the fuel supply and consumption.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane

Sentencas: The increase in the polarization resistance of the cell might originate from the small amount of NiO and residual carbon at the anode, which can be removed via an oxidation-and-reduction maintenance process.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane

Sentencas: Based on the above strategy, this work provides an alternative operating mode to improve the stability of direct methane SOFCs and demonstrates the feasibility of its application.
Titulo: Controlled deposition and utilization of carbon on Ni-YSZ anodes of SOFCs operating on dry methane
